resources.string: Nitrate is an inorganic compound that occurs under a variety of conditions in the environment, both naturally and synthetically.
Nitrate is regulated in drinking water primarily because excess levels can cause methemoglobinemia, or "blue baby" disease.
Nitrate does not normally cause health problems unless it is reduced to nitrite. The suggestion value is 10 mg/l nitrate as a maximum
Cyanide is produced by the decomposition of some plants, can be present in some foods such as green almonds and improperly prepared cassava, and can be produced by some microorganisms.
Cyanide is very poisonous and ingesting high levels of cyanide may cause breathing difficulties, convulsion, loss of consciousness, brain and heart damage, or even coma and death.

The World Health Organisation recommends that people should not consume water with a cyanide concentration above 0.5 mg/L for more than 5 days.It recommend that drinking water contain less than of 0.08 mg/L of cyanide.
